title: 111_hr899
content:
The Act is titled the "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" and requires a special election in case of a vacancy in the office of a Senator. The "Ethical and Legal Elections for Congressional Transitions Act" mandates a special election to fill a Senate vacancy within 90 days of certification by the President of the Senate. The state's chief executive will issue a writ of election in accordance with state laws. An exception exists for vacancies near a regularly scheduled election. Scheduled Election.--Subsection (a) does not apply to a Senate vacancy if the President of the Senate certifies:
(1) within 90 days of a scheduled general election for the office; or
(2) between a general election and the start of the next Congress.
Rule of Construction: States can still appoint temporary Senators until a special election is held. A temporary appointment can be made to fill a Senate vacancy until a special election is held, or until an individual is elected in the special election. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 has been amended to include payments to reimburse states for costs incurred in holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 has been amended to authorize payments to eligible states for costs related to holding special elections to fill Senate vacancies. States must submit a statement detailing incurred or anticipated costs to receive payment. The Commission may require information and assurances for payments to states for special elections. The payment amount is 50% of reasonable costs incurred or anticipated by the state. Payments must be made within 30 days of receiving the state's statement. States must agree to repay any excess payments. The Commission requires states to repay any excess payments received for special elections, which is the difference between the payment amount and the actual costs incurred by the state. Authorization of appropriations for payments under the Help America Vote Act of 2002 for special elections to fill Senate vacancies.
